original: Alm, Karl August Ivar, teol. dr, lektor, Motala, f. 8/1/97 i Kumla. G. 33i m. Karin Appelgren. Barn: Sigurd f. 34, Göran 35, Gudrun 39, Ingegerd 43. — Stud:ex. i Upps. 17, fil. kand. 19, teol. kand. 23, p«rästv. f. Västerås stift 24, teol. hc. 34, teol. dr 36, prov-år 42, utn. t. lektor v. h. a. 1. i Motala 47. Pastorsadj. i Lindesberg o. Falun, kyrkoadj. i Nås 26, i Leksand 27-30, i Norrbärke 30-31, kyrkoh. i Västervåla 32. Ordf. i sällsk. f. pas-totralpsyk. fr. 44. Stud:res. t. Zürich 30, 33, t. Tyskl. o. Engl. Skr.: Den relig. funktionen i människosjälen (grad:avh. 3’6), art. i tidn. o. tidskr. Andra pris i NDAs nord. förf :tävl. 37 öv. ämn.: Är vår relig. mogen f. en ny refocmation ? Övers, psykol. Htt.
translated: Alm, Karl August Ivar, Doctor of Theology, lecturer, from Motala, born on January 8th, 1897 in Kumla. Married in 1933 to Karin Appelgren. Children: Sigurd born in 1934, Göran in 1935, Gudrun in 1939, Ingegerd in 1943. He graduated from Uppsala University with a high school diploma in 1917 and a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1919. He earned a Bachelor of Theology degree in 1923, was ordained as a priest in the Västerås diocese in 1924, earned a theological licentiate degree in 1934, and a Doctor of Theology degree in 1936. He completed a probationary year in 1942 and was appointed as a lecturer at Högre allmänna läroverket in Motala in 1947. He was a pastorsadjunkt in Lindesberg and Falun, a kyrkoadjunkt in Nås from 1926 to 1930, in Leksand from 1927 to 1930, and in Norrbärke from 1930 to 1931. He was a kyrkoherde in Västervåla in 1932 and was the chair of the Society for Pastoral Psychology in 1944. He studied abroad in Zurich in 1930 and 1933, and in Germany and England. He wrote a thesis called "The Religious Function in the Human Soul" (degree: dissertation 3'6) and articles in journals and magazines. He won second prize in the NDA's Nordic competition in 1937 for his essay "Is our religion mature for a new reformation?" He also translated psychological literature.
